forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind around 18 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind 6 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, a gentle dance of clouds paints the sky, hinting at the possibility of light rain later, yet there remains a patchwork of blue breaking through. The air is crisp, as the temperatures hover near 56 degrees, gradually yielding to a slightly cooler 54 by the afternoon, accompanied by a consistent west wind that sways at 18 mph. This breeze carries a blend of freshness and a whisper of the ocean, making the two chances of rain, each at a modest 20%, feel almost incidental. The day is a refusal to settle into the soft embrace of fog; instead, it offers a play of light among the varied hues of the architecture below.

As evening approaches and darkness drapes gently over the city, expect the temperatures to dip into the cozy realm of 48 degrees. A modest northwest wind persists, whispering tales of the sea. Given these conditions, a simple layering of a light sweater over a long-sleeve shirt will serve nicely, perhaps with a breathable jacket for those venturing out after sundown. As the light wanes, consider a leisurely stroll along any of the nearby waterfronts or savoring a warm drink at a local café, allowing the soothing rhythms of urban life to serenade your senses in this compelling coastal city.
